shortdesc.ph: Registers a video frame observer for encoded video frames.
Registers a video frame observer for encoded video images.
Registers a video frame observer for encoded video images.
Registers a video frame receiver observer for encoded video images.

p.codeblock: public abstract int RegisterVideoEncodedFrameObserver(IVideoEncodedFrameObserver videoEncodedImageReceiver, OBSERVER_MODE mode = OBSERVER_MODE.INTPTR);

section.p: If you only want to observe encoded video frames (e.g., H.264 format) and do not need to decode or render them, Agora recommends using this method to register an class.
If you only want to observe encoded video frames (e.g., H.264 format) without decoding and rendering them, Agora recommends registering an class using this method.
If you only want to observe encoded video frames (such as H.264 format) without decoding and rendering, Agora recommends that you register a class using this method.
If you only want to observe encoded video frames (such as H.264 format) and do not need to decode and render the video, Agora recommends that you register an class using this method.
section.note: This method must be called before joining a channel.
This method must be called before joining a channel.
This method must be called before joining a channel.
This method must be called before joining a channel.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
